data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Every step must be taken in the direction you face forward. If you walk right and turn right, then you' re facing left. If you walk left and turn left, this is the correct way to walk. In order to walk backward the sequence in the instructions would require back to front. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can turn around to turn right where they started. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you wanted to return to the starting point take 6 steps and then take 4 steps. If you are looking back you would take 10 steps and then go back around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There is a start point where the direction changes but it is never in the direction taken. The starting point moves backwards as the number of steps increases. Taking one step backwards starts the sequence. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must return to the starting point when you make the turn to the left. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around and then take 7 steps. Take one step and turn around. You repeat the previous 6 steps several times. So, the answer is no.

Just because 8 steps are missing does not mean you should take 9 steps. You would have to walk 8 steps in either direction to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Take 6 steps to go around a circle. Turn around and take another 8 steps. Take 2 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step, you face forward, the second step is pointing towards the left, the third step is pointing towards the right, and the fourth step is pointing towards the right. If you would take 6 steps forward, you would take 6 steps left, 4 steps right, and 4 steps forward the same. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The three-step sequence is a combination of 6 directions: take 3, take 6, take 2, take 2, then take 3. The only ways to get back to the starting point are to take 3 steps and take 3 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Take one step backward. A step backward should always be taken first. So, the answer is yes.

Keep facing forward. One can return to where they started. So, the answer is No.

Take 4 steps right and you return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you won’t get lost and cannot be distracted by moving your feet. If you repeat the instructions for another walk, you won’t get lost and this will occur repeatedly. The answer: No.

For every step you make with the instructions, you are taking a step backward from the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn right into the street with the sidewalk in front of you. Turn right then take a step towards the middle of the street where you will see the street leading out of it. Turn right and return to the streets. So, the answer is Yes.

You will always return to the beginning point with 7 steps left. If you change directions 1 step backward is 2 steps right. If you have taken 6 steps to go 2 steps forward is 5 steps backward. If you take 7 and make your new direction go forward you are always facing forward and going forward with no backward steps. If you always face forward, you take two steps backward followed by two steps forward. To reverse the direction of the flow, take two steps to the right and one to the left, then turn your attention to the direction you took those first steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Whenever one takes 5 steps backwards, they are starting from the point of origin. Turning right and returning to a starting point have the same repercussions. Thus, the answer is No.

Facing forward is the same as facing forward. In an ordered sequence, from left to right, you can only take 4 steps forward while facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.
